p: Wood and other cellulosic products are hygroscopic (hydrogen bonds). Live plants may contain substantial amounts of water, i.e., >100% relative to being oven dried 48 h at 105 Â°C [ 7]. Dead wood, when not soaked contains less than 30 wt % (weight %) water to the dry weight basis. The Equilibrium Moisture Content (EMC) is a function of the air Relative Humidity (RH) shown in Figure 2. There may be some hysteresis [ 38], but in principle, wood drier or wetter than the actual EMC, will approach the EMC value by absorbing or releasing humidity (drying).
